abstract.text: An element that matches the provided element type and identifier.

inlineContent.text: An optional identifier string to match against any one of each element’s identifying properties:

abstract.text: Create and run unit tests, performance tests, and UI tests for your Xcode project.
A UI element in an application.
The types of UI element that you find, inspect, and interact with in a UI test.
The element’s accessibility identifier.
The label attribute of the element.
The value that is displayed when the element has no value.
The title attribute of the element.
The raw value attribute of the element.
An object that defines the search criteria a test uses to identify UI elements.
Immediately evaluates the query and returns an array of elements bound to the resulting accessibility elements.
Immediately evaluates the query and returns an array of elements bound by the index of each result.
Evaluates the query and returns the number of elements that match.
The query’s single matching element.
Returns an element that resolves to the index into the query’s result set.
An element that uses an index into the query’s results to determine which underlying accessibility element to use.
An element that matches the predicate.
An element that matches the provided element type and identifier.
Returns a descendant element that matches a provided identifier.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.

inlineContent.text: An optional identifier string to match against any one of each element’s identifying properties:

value.text: A static, plain-text Unicode string object.
